meanings.definition: The action of surrounding or enclosing something.
meanings.sent1: The encompassment of the garden by a fence kept the rabbits out.
meanings.sent2: The encompassment of the city by mountains made it a picturesque location.
meanings.sent3: The encompassment of the cake by eager children led to a hilarious chase.
meanings.sent4: The encompassment of the sky by dark clouds signaled an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The encompassment of the room by colorful balloons created a festive atmosphere.

meanings.definition: The state of being completely surrounded or enclosed.
meanings.sent1: The encompassment of the island by water made it feel isolated.
meanings.sent2: The encompassment of the house by trees provided privacy for the residents.
meanings.sent3: The encompassment of the cat by playful puppies resulted in a funny scene.
meanings.sent4: The encompassment of the heart by love brought warmth and joy.
meanings.sent5: The encompassment of the mind by knowledge expanded horizons.
